citation.article-title: Kocuria halotolerans sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from a saline soil in China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Kocuria halotolerans sp. nov.
Kocuria halotolerans (ha.lo.to′le.rans. Gr. n. hals, halos salt; L. pres. part. tolerans tolerating, enduring; N.L. part. adj. halotolerans, salt-tolerating).
Cells are Gram-positive, coccoid (0.6–1 μm in diameter), non-motile and non-endospore-forming.
Colonies are pale yellow, circular, opaque, slightly convex, smooth and approximately 1.0 mm in diameter after 24 h at 37 °C on modified ISP 5 medium containing 5 % NaCl.
No water-soluble exopigment is formed.

Grows at 10–37 °C, at pH 6.0–9.0 and in the presence of 0–10 % (w/v) NaCl, but no growth is observed at 4 or 45 °C, above pH 10 or in the presence of 15 % NaCl; optimal growth occurs with 5 % NaCl, at pH 7.0–8.0 and at 28–37 °C.
Catalase-positive but oxidase-negative.
Hydrolyses aesculin but not gelatin, starch or Tweens 20, 40 or 80.
Hydrogen sulfide is not produced.
Nitrate reduction is positive.

In the API 50 CH test system, acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, aesculin, amygdalin, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, arbutin, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, inositol, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melezitose, d-ribose, salicin, d-sorbitol, d-tagatose and turanose; acid production from glycerol, sucrose and potassium gluconate is weak.

No acid is produced from d-arabinose, l-arabitol, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, dl-fucose, gentiobiose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, glycogen, inulin, d-lactose, d-lyxose, melibiose, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, potassium 2-ketogluconate, potassium 5-ketogluconate, raffinose, l-rhamnose, starch, l-sorbose, trehalose, xylitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside or dl-xylose.

In the API Coryne system, positive for nitrate reduction, pyrazinamidase, alkaline phosphatase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, and fermentation of d-glucose, d-ribose, maltose and d-mannitol; variable for fermentation of sucrose.
Negative for pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, urease, gelatin hydrolysis, and acid production from d-lactose, d-xylose and glycogen.
In the API ZYM system, positive for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase.

Negative for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
The peptidoglycan type is Lys–Ala3 (variation A3α).
Whole cell-wall sugars are galactose and glucose.
Major phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
Menaquinones are MK-7(H2) (86.3 %), MK-8(H2) (11.8 %) and MK-6(H2) (1.8 %).

Major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (47.7 %), iso-C16 : 0 (15.7 %) and anteiso-C17 : 0 (22.1 %); minor amounts of C16 : 0 (6.2 %), iso-C14 : 0 (1.4 %), C14 : 0 (1.3 %), iso-C15 : 0 (1.1 %), C18 : 2ω6,9c/anteiso-C18 : 0 (1.4 %), C18 : 1ω9c (1.9 %) and C18 : 0 (1.3 %) are also detected.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.0 mol%.

The type strain, YIM 90716T (=DSM 18442T=KCTC 19172T=CCTCC AB 206069T), was isolated from a saline soil sample collected from Ganjiahu Suosuo Forest National Nature Reserve, Xinjiang Province, north-west China.
